issue.title: 🚀 Keep web3swift growing! An upgraded will be launched with your support! 🚀
issue.body:
## Important notice:

### [We’re participating in the @gitcoin Grants CLR Round 4](https://gitcoin.co/grants/358/web3swift )

### Drop a few $ into this grant and leverage your power to help. #QuadraticFunding makes every donated DAI count! 💸

Cheers! <https://gitcoin.co/grants/358/web3swift >

issue.title: This repo is not currently updated, use matterinc/web3swift instead
issue.body:
As the main contributors of this project I request to put this notice back.
We are agreed to leave this project "as is" for the good of BANKEX team. 
Since this repo not supported by bankex, please make a reference to actually updated library in order to not confuse the developers.

You are welcome to contribute to this project, but leave this to mention on the place as a kind of respect to our work.

---

## Important notice: 
### This version is not currently supported updated.
## Use [matterinc/web3swift](https://github.com/matterinc/web3swift) instead.

> As we've left the company BANKEX and I was the main enthusiast maintainer of this project, all the further work and updates will be done in the new repo.
>*Sincerely,*
>*Alex (@shamatar)*

> We will continue working at *web3swift* library within our core team in our new company.
>We are committed to make it more powerful and push new updates to [matterinc/web3swift](https://github.com/matterinc/web3swift)
>*Regards,*
>*Petr Korolev (@skywinder)*

---
 This is revert commit of https://github.com/BANKEX/web3swift/commit/fd6e78b3530980b15a0c0858d445a006cc039364#diff-04c6e90faac2675aa89e2176d2eec7d8

Project Archive
issue.body:
When archiving this project, it is taking an extremely long time. (4 - 6 hrs)
I've now completely removed this pod, and am looking at other web3 solutions.

Any thing I can do to speed up this archival process.  :<

issue.title: What's the current status of this project?
issue.body: I've noticed that the information about development freeze has been removed. Does this mean that the project will be actively developed again, or at least maintained? @v57, could you please clarify?

Support Infura V3
Invalid method signature
issue.body:
In a contract, I have a public property called `index`.

In the iOS app, I try to get this value using the following code:
```
let web3 =  Web3(url: URL(string: "server adress")!)!
let abi = "Full ABI goes here"
let cotractAddress = "0x....."
let contract = try! web3.contract(abi, at: contractAddress)
let response = try! contract.method("index", options: nil).callPromise().wait()
```

When I run this code, I get `web3swift.Web3Error.processingError("Can not decode returned parameters")` error.

To find the reason for this issue I've compared request sent from `web3swift` with the request sent by the javascript version of web3. It turned out that requests had different method signatures.

Method signature for `web3swift` was `0xdfcbe054` where for `web3 js` it was `0x2986c0e5`. 

I've checked online [tool](https://emn178.github.io/online-tools/keccak_256.html) for `index()` and it generates the same hash as `web3 js` - `0x2986c0e5`.

It looks like that `ABIv2.Element.Function.methodEncoding` is returning incorrect value. 
Or to be more precise, the `keccak256()` is generating the wrong hash,  as the input data for hashing `ABIv2.Element.Function.signature` is valid.

What's interesting, the `keccak256()` is generating a proper hash for longer method names e.g: `voteForCandidate()`.

**Additional information**
web3swift version: 2.1.10
iOS: 12.2
Xcode: 10.2.1

I think this is not necessary for this issue, but, just in case, here is the definition of index property from ABI (rest of the ABI is removed for brevity):
```
{
  "constant": true,
  "inputs": [],
  "name": "index",
  "outputs": [
    {
      "name": "",
      "type": "uint256"
    }
  ],
  "payable": false,
  "stateMutability": "view",
  "type": "function"
}
```
